author: cloudyboy16

text: @SonicArtist313 Thanks so much for composing such relaxing, and nostalgic music!
author: electricmastro

text: @electricmastro Yes, that is what I am talking about.  It was typical of Nintendo to add credits unscrupously for marketing or internal reasons.  I helped found Paradigm, the company that made PilotWings 64, and I had worked with them for 7 years before doing that game.  I wrote, arranged, sequenced, programmed, mixed and installed every track in the game.  Mr. Nakatsuka had nothing to do with the music in the game whatsoever.  Mr. Wada approved each of the tracks on site in Dallas.
author: Dan Hess

text: Dan Hess Thank you for your work sir, you helped a lot of us build memorable experiences.
author: xcaluhbration

text: OMG, what I posted here is not true!  I forgot about the intro song which is a remake I did of the original SNES version that Mr. Nakatsuka created!!  Please forgive me!!  I feel terrible about not crediting Mr. Nakatsuka!!
author: Dan Hess

text: @SonicArtist313 It says somewhere that Akito Nakatsuka arranged it too.
author: electricmastro

text: @electricmastro LOL!  Yeah, I get the porno reference.  Not quite what I intended, but what the hell.  And, yes, I am Dan Hess.  By the way, despite the game credit given, there were NO other composers/arrangers on the PilotWings game.  I personally checked in each and every track to the tree (software dev term).  Any other reference is Nintendo hype.
author: Dan Hess

text: @SonicArtist313 I assume you're Dan Hess?
author: electricmastro

text: @SonicArtist313 I always think it's rare for the actual composers to stumble upon this. As badoujobeale put it, it sounds like something out of a retro porn movie! XD
author: electricmastro

text: @electricmastro  Thanks!  I think it's awesome that people take the time to post their responses to my music!
author: Dan Hess

text: @SonicArtist313 I think it's awesome when the actual composers respond to their own music, :D
author: electricmastro

text: Lovin' the comments.  I wrote the soundtrack to Pilotwings 64 and it is so good to see that it wasn't lost on the target audience.  I have posted this on a few of the videos from the soundtrack, but most 40 year old reviewers didn't get it at the time.  I had a frickin blast working on the game.  Different times...
author: Dan Hess

text: I realise this is 8 years old. But this is incredibly chill stuff. I haven't looked up your history at all but I do hope you haven't stopped.
